titles.title: Washington-Lincoln Recognition Act of 2007
To recognize the birthdays of Presidents George Washington and Abraham Lincoln.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.summary: 1/4/2007--Introduced. Washington-Lincoln Recognition Act of 2007 - States that (the legal public holiday) Washington's Birthday shall be referred to solely as such: (1) by all U.S. entities and officials; and (2) on all federally funded publications. Requests that the President issue an annual proclamation recognizing President Lincoln's birthday.
